page.title: 07DOUNBY FARM STUDY: PRESENT
page.content: Mr.& Mrs. Hourston own{Dounby Farm just outside the village. Four people live on the farm and two people work there. They have 205 acres of land. Most of his crop is grass for silage and a little bit of barley. Mr. Hourston has 80 cows and he keeps all his young cattle until they are fat and then sells them. He used to keep chickens but doesn't now. There are three tractors on his farm. He has a lot of other implements including ploughs, silage cutters, foragers and bailers. They feed the cows indoors during the winter. In the spring and summer there is fencing to mend and weed killing to be done as well as spreading slurry and manure, and calving. In the autumn there is the harvest.
